did.unittitle: Terris Devereaux family papers and photographs
did.abstract: The Terris Devereaux family papers and photographs comprise materials relate to the Aghamalian family, an Armenian-Irish family living in Brooklyn in the early 20th century. The bulk of the materials relate to Harent Aghamalian and his children, including family documents, photographs, correspondence, and materials related to his work. The materials also include family photos from Aghamalian's grandson, Terris Devereaux's life in the mid-twentieth century.
did.langmaterial: Materials in both English and Armenian.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged into four folders: family documents, personal correspondence, photographs, and annotated photos.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Terris Devereaux (1951 - 2016) was the son of Robert Paul Aghamalian, also known as Robert Devereaux (1923 - 1983). Robert Devereaux attended Erasmus High School and served in World War II. He is the son of Harent Aghamalian, who is heavily represented in these papers. Terris Devereaux grew up in Westport and Darien, Connecticut and attended Darien High School.

Harent Aghamalian (1885-1955) was born in Harpoot, Armenia and immigrated to New York in April of 1901. In 1902, he married Delia Monahan (1882-1952), an Irish immigrant. Together they had six children: Lillian, Mary, George, Helen, Louis, and Robert. Harent Aghamalian was a businessman, owning various properties, including one on Montague Street in Brooklyn Heights. He also owned a parking garage in Manhattan near Roosevelt Island. He lived in Brooklyn throughout his life in the United States and was involved in multiple community organizations, including: the Brooklyn chapter of the Armenian General Benevolent Union, the Armenian Apostolic Church, and the Brooklyn Lodge of Elks No. 22. He was also treasurer of A. & G. Holding Corporation and president of Arachnortoran.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The papers were processed, arranged, and described by Laura Michael, June-August 2025 at the folder level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These family papers and photographs contain materials relating to the family history of the Aghamalian family. Most materials are from the first half of the 20th century, ranging from 1910-1950s. The folder titled 'Annotated Photos' contains photocopies of what appear to be pages from a photo album and their corresponding captions from the creator. These family photo albums of the Devereaux family, which are from the second half of the 20th century, range from the 1950s to the 1980s. The early 20th century materials specifically relate to the Aghamalian family and include photographs, obituaries, death certificates, immigration documents, correspondence, newspaper clippings and a newsletter, Hoosharar, from the Armenian General Benevolent Union. These materials especially relate to Harent Aghamalian's life and death. A few materials are written in Armenian script.
